title: San Pablo Peninsula
text:
San Pablo Peninsula is a <a href="peninsula">peninsula</a> in western <a href="Richmond%2C%20California">Richmond</a>, between <a href="San%20Pablo%20Bay">San Pablo Bay</a> and <a href="San%20Rafael%20Bay">San Rafael Bay</a>, in southwestern <a href="Contra%20Costa%20County%2C%20California">Contra Costa County, California</a>.
Geography.
The peninsula runs between <a href="Castro%20Cove">Castro Cove</a> and <a href="Point%20San%20Pablo">Point San Pablo</a>, and is dominated by the steep ridges of the <a href="Potrero%20Hills%20%28Richmond%2C%20California%29">Potrero Hills</a>, an escarpment that runs along the entire peninsula. 
The peninsula is largely owned by <a href="Chevron%20Corporation">Chevron</a> and is used as a safety buffer for security purposes (see <a href="Chevron%20Richmond%20Refinery">Chevron Richmond Refinery</a>). 
Features.
